text: (upbeat country music)
♪ Gonna smoke me a fatty brisket ♪
♪ I got my barbecue shoes on ♪
♪ Gonna smoke me a fatty brisket ♪

- [Narrator] Welcome
to the bbqpitboys.com.

Today we're cookin' up
some boneless beef ribs
on the grill and they're real easy to do.

Alright, first off, these
are not ribs, alright?

This is what the beef industry
calls is boneless ribs

and they're also sold as beef
chuck, Western style ribs

or beef country style ribs but
it's the shoulder, alright?

And it's cut from the
shoulder clod, butterfly.
It's a real tough piece of meat
and there's only one way to deal with it
and that's to braise it.

It's gonna take some time, let
me show you how to do this.

First way we're gonna do is
prep it with a little bit of oil

alright, a good salad oil or
your favorite oil right there,
give it a little bit of coatin'
and then we're gonna season it,
a little bit of salt and pepper.
And although this looks tender,
looks like it's got plenty of fat,

a lot of it is connected
tissue, real tough eatin'.
Can hardly get a knife through it.
So, do it right, we're gonna do this,

braise it for about, say, two
hours maybe a little bit more,
and we're gonna make it real good.

Alright, so we've coated it
with a little bit of oil,
little bit of salt and pepper,
now we're gonna get the fire going,

we're gonna set our grill
up indirect, alright.
You know I'm about that, (blowtorch blows)
but let's get a fire going.
Now let's get these beef chuck,
Western style ribs on the grill,
or whatever they wanna call it.
First, we're gonna sear both sides.

We want a lot of that
flavor right into the meat,

we'll just do it direct
over the hot coals,

just like that, just a
minute or two each side.

We'll get some flavor
into this beef right off,
just like that. (fire crackles)
(light, bouncy music)
Alright (tongs clang against pan) now,
you take it after searing each side

and you throw it in a pan,
here we got a black iron pan
works real good like that. (beef sizzles)
Just sear the others, we got about maybe
four and half, five pounds here of beef.

Man, looks good enough
to eat already. (laughs)
But it's not. (beef sizzles)
Oh yeah, now if you've never had
beef chuck, Western style ribs before,

you're definitely missing
something out of your life,
you've got to check this out, yeah.
Alright.
Woo, that looks seared.
Throw these here in the black iron pan.
(tongs clang against pan)
And now we wanna braise 'em, alright?
And this is the important part.

First thing we're gonna do
is start out (cap pops off)
with a bottle of beer, alright?
And then choose your favorite beer. Psh.
(simple country music)
And this is what it's all about.

You gotta choose your
favorite sauce, alright?
Something that you can get off the shelf,
or one of our recipes, or one of yours.
This is the important part because
the taste of this is all about the sauce.
Here, we got some good, homemade sauce
we're gonna put up in there.

You wanna bring it almost
to the top of these ribs.
(mixture simmers)

Just like that, we're gonna
do a slow simmer, alright?

We don't wanna boil 'em,
we want a real slow simmer.
If you boil 'em, they'll just be tough.
Do a slow simmer for a couple hours,

and it'll be good,
alright? (grate slams shut)

And here I'm throwing a
chunk of apple wood in there,

'cause we wanna that flavor
that sauce just a little bit.
Oh yeah.

Now, 'bout 20 minutes has gone
by and I'm gonna check these.

Phew, see that? Got a
little slow simmer going on.
You may have to turn your pan, alright,
depending how your grill is set up.

Now, if you're on a gas

you may not have to do this.
I'm just gonna turn this pan around
so we get that even simmer, alright?
And again, slow simmer.
Yeah.
Now, about an hour has gone by,
we're gonna check these ribs,
we've got that nice, slow simmer going on.
Oh man. (mixture simmers)
What you wanna do every once in a while
is turn the ribs, just like this.

This assures that everything

tenderized, oh yeah, smells good.

And this, the level of the

Don't wanna cover it, but
bring it up to the top.
Just like that.

Alright, let's check these ribs. Man.
Gonna a little more chunked wood in there,

don't want a lot of smoke,
just a little bit, alright?

Too much smoke will just

just want to flavor it slightly.

And this is why you wanna
do it on the grill too,
not the kitchen stove.
Man, take a look at that.
Lord, have mercy.
The hardest part of this recipe
is just takes a couple hours of your time.
Put the cover on, we're almost done.

Through the miracle of time,

I'd say these ribs are done,

Damn, they're gonna be fork

I'd say it's time to eat.
